change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 240/2015, effective December 18, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who, under section 33 (1) of the Act, may appeal an order, decision or determination to the commission must submit a notice of appeal to the commission that is signed by, or on behalf of, the appellant and contains all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the appellant, and the name of the person, if any, making the request on the appellant's behalf;
the address for service of the appellant;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The appellant must deliver the notice of appeal to the commission not later than 3 weeks after the later of the date of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the decision of the council under section 32 (2) of the Act, and
the order, decision or determination referred to in section 33 (1) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before or after the time limit in subsection (2) expires, the commission may extend it.
A person who does not deliver a notice of appeal within the time specified loses the right to an appeal.

change.changenote: Section 10 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 240/2015, effective December 18, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a notice of appeal does not comply with section 9 the commission may deliver a written notice of deficiencies to the appellant, inviting the appellant, within a period specified in the notice, to submit further material remedying the deficiencies.
If the commission delivers a notice under subsection (1), the appeal may proceed only after the earlier of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the expiry of the period specified in the notice of deficiencies, and
the submission to the commission of further material remedying the deficiencies.
